A little while later we were both ready\nto talk again.%K%P
'I'm sorry, Sho. I just ended up causing\nyou trouble.'%K%P
'Nah, it's my fault for walking in on you.\nDon't beat yourself up over it.'%K%P
'Besides, it was worth it to get to see you\nin your underwear.'%K%P
'You're such a perv...'%K%P
Maika rested her head against my shoulder.%K%P
The feeling of her weight against me felt good,\nit made me feel closer to her.%K%P
I'd gently squeezed Maika's hand. She seemed\nsurprised, her whole body trembled,\nbut just for a moment.%K%P
Then she squeezed back.%K%P
'I never thought we could be together like this.\nI was so happy to find out you felt the same way\nabout me as I feel about you.'%K%P
'I'm sorry I didn't realize sooner. There must be\nsomething wrong with my eyes for me to have\ntaken so long.'%K%P
'Yeah, seriously.'%K%P
She giggled as we joked together.%K%P
Needless to say, I found that unbearably cute.%K%P
'Sho, I've been thinking.'%K%P
'About what?'%K%P
'I love this place and the time we've spent\nhere together. I want to protect it, too.'%K%P
'I think a part of me wanted to keep it like\nit's always been, a place for just you and me.\nBut not anymore.'%K%P
'Even if Akane's rehabilitation goes smoothly,\nTsubaki will still have to close down someday.\nUnless we do something about it.'%K%P
She was right. Even if our work with Akane did pay\noff, it was hard to keep a boarding\nhouse running if no one lived there.%K%P
The fact that we'd need to attract more tenants\nhad crossed my mind.%K%P
'Does that mean you've thought of something\nwe can do?'%K%P
'Yep. I was thinking we could make it a residence for\nother goddesses like Akane.'%K%P
'Other goddesses?'%K%P
'Yeah. The kind that have trouble fitting in, that\nmight need a little help reforming themselves.'%K%P
'It could breathe new life into this place!\nThen we could both get to stay here, together.'%K%P
'What do you think?'%K%P
Maika looked at me nervously.%K%P
Wanting to put her at ease, I nodded.%K%P
'It's a great idea. If we can't get human tenants,\nfind some divine ones instead. You've found\na gap in the market.'%K%P
Not many people lived around here anymore, and normal\ngoddesses had no trouble finding accommodation.\nAragami were a different story, though.%K%P
This plan could really work.%K%P
'Right? That's why I'm going to start helping\nwith Akane's rehabilitation.'%K%P
'I'd be glad to have your help,\nbut don't rush into anything with her.\nRemember what happened last time.'%K%P
'She's cheered up now, so things should be fine.\nI won't be too harsh on her.'%K%P
Maika seemed confident, but there was still some\ndoubt in my heart that I couldn't shake.%K%P
'Just remember Akane's already working\nreally hard. Try to take a balanced approach.'%K%P
'You sure know a lot about Akane.'%K%P
'Well, I've spent a lot of time with her.'%K%P
'You must be an expert on her by now, huh?'%K%P
'I wouldn't go that far. Besides, I'm much more\ninterested in learning about you.'%K%P
'I can't believe you can say that with a\nstraight face.'%K%P
While Maika laughed, I thought over what we'd\njust talked about.%K%P
I was glad she was enthusiastic about this, but I\nfelt like I'd need to be on the lookout for\npotential trouble.%K%P
I did my best to push my doubts from my mind.%K%P
